data.title: Shaun O’Brien, one of the country’s most celebrated character dancers, dancing for four decades with the New York City Ballet included more...
data.meta_description: 436 likes, 11 comments - richard_stabbert on February 18, 2024: "Shaun O’Brien, one of the country’s most celebrated character dancers, dancing for four decades with the New York City Ballet included more than 30 holiday seasons in “The Nutcracker” Having joined the ballet company a year after its creation in 1948 until he retired in 1991, Shaun owed this longevity, remarkable in ballet, to his having slipped early on — unintentionally but quite happily — into character roles. He would become a perennial audience favorite for nearly all that time. Shaun began a romantic relationship with actor/ photographer Cris Alexander in the 1940’s and the couple would remain together for the next 60 years. They would live to see gay marriage legalized and in 2011 tied the knot. Shaun and Alexander died less than two weeks apart, Alexander age 92 and Shaun passing first age 86., having shared their life and their love.".
